intro: Leysera odorata, commonly known as the fragrant mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of trees and shrubs. It has small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along its stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Leysera odorata is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
